prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
Example:
Question:
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My first client. Just standing in front of this guy makes me nervous...
Character 1
Name: Shadi Smith
Description: The victim in this case. A traveler, only recently back in-country.
Character 2
Name: Winston Payne
Description: The prosecuting attorney. For all his experience, he lacks a certain presence...
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Post-Mortem Report
Description: Death occurred a little after 2 p.m. and was caused by loss of blood from a gunshot to the chest. The bullet did not pass through the victim's body.
Evidence 1
Name: Photograph of Victim
Description: A photographic print that shows the victim. He was shot from the front in the chest and subsequently died.
Evidence 2:
Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A bottle of carbonated water and a steak lunch can be seen on the victim's table.
Evidence 3:
Name: Medical Report Card
Description: A record of dental work. On the day of the murder, the victim had undergone dental treatment and been prohibited from eating or drinking anything but water.
Evidence 4:
Name: Photograph of Handbag
Description: A photograph taken by Hosonaga-san after the incident occurred. It shows Miss Brett's handbag on a chair by the victim's table.
Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was ingesting a regulation beef steak at the restaurant while having a tactical discussion with the old man.
Person: Nosa
Testimony 1
Testimony 1: Myself, I was extolling the virtues of a particularly fine golden curio to the military gentleman.
Person: Korekuta
Testimony 2
Testimony 2: At that precise moment, a firearm was discharged! I observed the enemy's actions with my own eyes!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 3
Testimony 3: The black-uniformed varsity cadet fired on the English civilian! And from the back, the cowardly little weasel!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 4
Testimony 4: I was on my hands and knees, investigating the where-abouts of my mysteriously absconded precious curio.
Person: Korekuta

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies provided.
Testimony 3 states that the gun shot was fired "from the back". However, Evidence 0, which is "Post-Mortem Report," states that the victim died "from a gunshot to the chest", which implies that the witness is lying.
{"evidence": 0, "testimony": 3}
Question:Characters:
Character 0
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: A student working part-time at the offices of Edgeworth and Co. Studying to be an attorney.
Character 1
Name: Samson Tangaroa
Description: My client, and a man said to be the greatest confectioner of his generation.
Character 2
Name: Artie Frost
Description: The murder victim. Found dead inside Samson Tangaroa's chocolate work.
Character 3
Name: Judy Bound
Description: Assistant to Samson Tangaroa. She's fond of the work of sculptor Paul Halique.
Character 4
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: The detective assigned to this case. A man of few words.
Character 5
Name: Carmelo Gusto
Description: A candy-crafting confectioner who's taking part in the contest.
Character 6
Name: Delicia Scone
Description: A confectioner who will do whatever it takes to achieve her goals.
Character 7
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: The prosecutor in charge of this case. It is said that he has never lost a trial in these past 25 years.
Character 8
Name: Laurice Deauxnim
Description: Pseudonym of Larry Butz, my friend since childhood. He fancies himself as something of an artist.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 10
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 11
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 12
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: The greatest prosecutor ever to prosecute... according to himself, anyway. In actual fact, his relationship with logic is tenuous at best.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. Polishing it every day has become just another part of my daily routine.
Evidence 1
Name: Seal
Description: A seal that was found near the body when it was discovered. What could the design signify?
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes about the crime scene. The police have taken custody of the body. [info] The victim's body found in Samson Tangaroa's room, inside a chocolate treasure chest. The cause of death appears to have been blood loss following blunt force trauma. [caption] The victim's body is curled inside a chest crushed by a ship post. The body is half covered by a blue sheet. There is a silver coin next to the body.
Evidence 3
Name: Mr. Tangaroa's Teapot
Description: A Paul Halique piece with Tangaroa's fingerprints on it.
Evidence 4
Name: Contest Rules
Description: A piece of paper listing the rules for the contest.
Evidence 5
Name: Frame Finger Marks
Description: Someone left finger marks on the chocolate frame, but didn't leave any prints.
Evidence 6
Name: Mansion Key
Description: The one and only key that unlocks every door in the mansion. Tangaroa was in possession of it the entire time.
Evidence 7
Name: Salt Lamp
Description: Salt lamp found in Scone's room. Stained with the victim's blood.
Evidence 8
Name: Fake Confections
Description: Ms. Scone's so-called creations were all fake plastic models, covered in a thick layer of whipped cream.
Evidence 9
Name: Chocolates
Description: Tangaroa's favorite, handmade by Bound. Rather misshapened, and incredibly sweet.
Evidence 10
Name: Instant Camera
Description: Takes photos that develop instantly. A new film cartridge has twenty exposures, but there are only three remaining.
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Frost's Room
Description: A photo of Frost's sculptures, taken by Judy Bound. Two photos, one from Bound and one from Detective Badd.
Evidence 12
Name: Ms. Scone's Statement
Description: Frost's sculptures were "scrumptious", except for the lyre, which was salty.
Evidence 13
Name: Semifinal Entries
Description: Frost's and Gusto's creations had different designs, but tasted the same.
Evidence 14
Name: Ultimate Cookbook
Description: A book containing formulas for creating a cure for taste disorders and other chemical and pharmaceutical items.
Evidence 15
Name: Victim's Blood
Description: Frost's blood was found in the fountain, but not at the scene of the crime.
Evidence 16
Name: Family Photo
Description: A photo of Frost, Gusto, and their sons. Gusto's son visited his father daily up through the semifinal.
Evidence 17
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 18
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Documents providing an overview of the IS-7 Incident. Documents received from Fender, including his comments in red.
Evidence 19
Name: Gallery Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet received upon entry to the gallery.
Evidence 20
Name: Winter Wing Photo
Description: Statues matching those made by the victim eighteen years ago.
Evidence 21
Name: Pisces Statue Sketch
Description: A sketch by Larry depicting the Pisces statue exactly as he saw it.
Evidence 22
Name: Used Blowtorch
Description: There are signs it was used just before the police arrived. Possibly to heat something?
Evidence 23
Name: Luminous Cloth
Description: Cloth that glows when connected to a full-spectrum light-emitting device. [caption] Looks like a blue sheet. Delicia Scone's property. One of these was lost eighteen years ago. Given to Bound by Scone. Lost eighteen years ago, only to be rediscovered floating in the fountain.
Evidence 24
Name: Poison Gas Ingredients
Description: The gas was produced when bright red Ubiquium and pure white Asphyxion were mixed together.
Evidence 25
Name: Ultimate Cookbook
Description: A book containing formulas for creating a cure for taste disorders and other chemical and pharmaceutical items.
Evidence 26
Name: Frame Finger Marks
Description: Finger marks left by someone in Tangaroa's room. No accompanying prints.
Evidence 27
Name: Salt Lamp
Description: A photograph of the murder weapon from the IS-7 Incident. It's a salt lamp stained with Frost's blood.
Evidence 28
Name: Family Photo
Description: A photo of Frost, Gusto, and their sons. Gusto's son visited his father daily up through the semifinal.
Evidence 29
Name: Teapot
Description: Designed by Paul Halique. One of Judy Bound's prize possessions.
Evidence 30
Name: Ceramic Fragment
Description: Found in a puddle of tea. The design looks familiar.
Evidence 31
Name: Lift Cart
Description: Used by Frost to transport ice eighteen years ago. The top of the platform is wet.
Evidence 32
Name: Larry's Sketches
Description: Sketches depicting exactly what Larry saw.
Evidence 33
Name: Gemini Case Analysis Results
Description: Results of the analysis conducted on the melted contents of the Gemini case.
Evidence 34
Name: Chocolates
Description: Handmade by Bound. Slightly melted after being kept in her pocket.
Evidence 35
Name: Statute of Limitations
Description: A book explaining the statutes of limitations of various crimes.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: If the body had been found in a locked room... Master would've been the prime suspect.
Person: Badd
Testimony 1
Testimony: That's why Master made sure to leave the door to his own room unlocked...
Person: Badd
Testimony 2
Testimony: And to ensure that the body would be seen... Master broke the lid on the treasure chest.
Person: Badd
Testimony 3
Testimony: After the judging... everyone was scheduled to meet in Master's room...
Person: Badd
Testimony 4
Testimony: That would have created the impression... that the murder had occurred... while he was away.
Person: Badd

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
cot:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies provided.

Testimony 0 states that "If the body had been found in a locked room... Master would've been the prime suspect." However, Evidence 6, the "Mansion Key," states that "Tangaroa was in possession of it the entire time," implying that the room could have been locked, contradicting the testimony that the door was left unlocked to avoid suspicion.

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
cot:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies provided.

Testimony 1 states that the poison gas was caused by Normallium, a chemical found in paint. However, Evidence 24, which is "Poison Gas Ingredients," states that the gas was produced when bright red Ubiquium and pure white Asphyxion were mixed together. This directly contradicts Testimony 1's claim about Normallium being the cause of the poison gas.
